page.title: 05FLOODING AT STAVERTON
page.content: Often when there has been heavy rain for several days, the River Avon floods in the valley at Staverton. The water gushes down by the bridge and lots of broken trees and grass are carried with it. The road floods and often vehicles get stranded with water coming inside and the drivers having to wade up the road. When the fields are all flooded, there is a man with a sailing boat who sails round the fields. If you stand in the churchyard, there is a lovely view of the floods and people come from all the villages around to have a look and to laugh at those who get stuck! One year, the floods came during the winter and some of the fields where the flood was not too deep froze and everyone had fun sliding on the ice.
